Posts.Title: 6 month follow up mammo tomorrow Petitegal127 Petitegal127

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2013 07:51PM AnxietyAnne wrote: I went to a consultation today for my biopsy. I was so freaked out that it was in the cancer center. I expected to go in and schedule my surgery. The doctor had the word oncologist on her jacket. All of this has my heart racing and I just wanted to leave. I had to undress from waist up so that she could examine my breasts. I really need to have someone with me at these appointments. I do remember her saying 85% chance it is nothing. She said that it is fine to wait the 5 weeks to have the biopsy until my husband comes home. She said enjoy your Thanksgiving. The nurse said that she was a BC and lung cancer survivor and told me that I was going to be just fine and gave me a hug. I got dressed and took the wrong exit. I was trapped in the stairwell. My doctor heard me knocking and led me to the exit. I am still trying to calm my nerves.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2013 02:48AM AnxietyAnne wrote: Pokemom sorry to hear that you have DCIS, but glad to hear how early it was caught. I have no one else, so I have to wait. Best of luck to you.

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2013 02:33AM AnxietyAnne wrote: Pokemom, I would love to have you go with me but I am quite a few states away. My biopsy will be day surgery. The surgeon says it is routine, but I have to be put to sleep. I would like to do it alone but they say I can't. That is why I am waiting till December when my husband is home. I did not want too much information at this time because I have too long to go until the biopsy and I can only handle so much right now. Mayanne I hope and pray for the best for you. The thought of waiting for my biopsy results sends a paralyzingly fear through me. I continue to pray for the strength to handle whatever I may have to go through. Praying for everyone on these boards.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2013 06:20PM AnxietyAnne wrote: Good luck tomorrow Mayanne.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2013 04:35AM AnxietyAnne wrote: Well, I have my biopsy on December 16 and the doctor called and said I will have a follow up on December 23. I am thinking , do I have to wait that long to know the results of the biopsy. Now yesterday I got a message from them saying that the follow up will be moved to the next day. Silly me before I call to confirm am thinking the follow up will be on the 17, the day after surgery, maybe because it was so close to the holidays that they were speeding things along. But no the follow up is now on December 24. Any day you hear bad news is awful, but I have family coming from across the country to spend the holidays. I don't want to ruin the holidays for my family. I just want to deal with this alone and not burden anyone. I know that my family will be so upset when I even tell them about the biopsy. I still have not said a word to my husband and he is so excited about being home for Christmas. He has not been home for Christmas in over 4 years due to his job. This may seem crazy but telling my family is as stressful as waiting for the results. I still have faith of a benign outcome, but of course that little voice in the back says "what if" . Mayanne I am reading over your post to keep my sanity and for encouragement. All the best to you.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: AnxietyAnne wrote: I had my annual mammogram. Two days later got "the call". Calcifications on my left breast. Panic set in and since then have googled so much I am mentally exhausted. I am 52 with no history of BC in family. On Halloween I went in for diagnostic. Now have to do biopsy. Consultation with surgeon on November 7. I really can't describe how I feel right now. I have to force myself to eat. This happens whenever I go through troubles in my life. I think my brain is in some kind of self-preservation mode because if I try to think too deep into my situation the thought goes out of my head. It's kind of weird this feeling like I am in denial, but I think this is my way to cope to keep from going off the deep end. Reading all of the posts on this message board also helps. May God bless you all with great news Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2013 07:14AM AnxietyAnne wrote: I still have not shared my fears with anyone but my boss, only because I needed to leave work early. She was very supportive and gave words of encouragement. After I talk with the surgeon Thursday, I will decide whether to tell my grown daughter. My husband is out of the country and won't be home till December. If they say I can wait until then to do the biopsy I will not tell my family anything until I have results. My husband does not know anything yet. I don't want my family to get worried because I know I will lose it then. This site is helping me so much. I have even had an appetite this weekend, and for me that is great because I have barely eaten since I was told on the 31st that I will have a biopsy. The person who gave me the news that I had to have the biopsy, I think he was a doctor, I was kind of numb,he said he is doing the biopsy to be sure and that it may be nothing. He said more but I don't remember lol. Today I am kind of panicky so I had to let my feelings out. I wish that I could stop thinking about things that I think might happen. I had to give up google because I have too much info for someone who does not even know what they may have to face.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results AnxietyAnne rikmorgan

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 10:56AM AnxietyAnne wrote: I am having such a rough time today. I am so scared and I want to cry but I know that if I start I won't stop. I don't even know what I am up against yet but I have been reading so much information that I have worked myself into a panic. I wish that I had the courage to get the biopsy over with instead of waiting till December.

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2014 04:26PM AnxietyAnne wrote: Teaspoonofsugar, I went through the wire placement and biopsy under general  anesthesia . My surgeon told from the start  that I would have to be put under because the microcalcifications were close to the chest wall. Wire placement was not bad, I didn't care about anything at the time but getting it over with so I followed directions well so that they could get it right the first time. Surgery went well and my results were benign.  I hope that all goes well with your procedures and that your results are benign.
